newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela Mavesa outlines dividends for 97.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela Mavesa outlines dividends for 97.

text.p: Leading Venezuelan food company Mavesa will pay an extraordinary one-for-one stock dividend in March, executive president Juan Fernando Roche said.

The executive board will also approve "a 0.4 bolivars per share first quarter dividend and 0.2 bolivars per share dividends for the following quarters," he told reporters after the company's annual general assembly.
The stock dividend will be paid-out of profits and will double the company's paid-up capital to 26.6 billion bolivars ($51 million), Roche added.
Mavesa reported net profits for the year ended October 31 1996 of 14 billion bolivars versus 9.0 billion in the year before.
Its American Depositary Shares, each backed by 20 shares of common stock, began freely trading on the New York Stock Exchange on January 7.
